name: art'otel berlin city center west

reviews.text: Hotel located near everything, tram, train, shopping. Rooms very nice decorated, extremely friendly staff, helpful and taking care of all requests.
reviews.title: Very nice location, close to everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only bad point and its not the hotel's fault is the disco across the street, noisy young crowd, drunken and very roudy girls.
reviews.title: Fantstic hotel in a fantastic city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I are just back from a 3 night stay at art'otel berlin city center west and have nothing but good things to say about it. I could waffle on about it for ages so I'll go for the concise option!
reviews.title: definitely coming back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: . Good location, 5 minute walk from U-bahn station and close to a main shopping area. Lovely bakery just around the corner on way to u-bahn.
reviews.title: Everything we could have wanted!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: . Room and shared areas all very clean with modern decor. Room serviced every morning.
reviews.title: Excellent base for exploring Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Neat and "artsy" hotel. But still not as "artsy" as they promote themselves to be. Anyways, that doesn't matter. The rooms were clean, simple and but maybe a little bit small. The bed was to the comfiest, but we still managed. There is a nice bar in the reception area where it's nice to have a drink before going out to dinner. There are several good restaurants in the area. Again I thought the breakfast was expensive, so we went out for breakfast. Out the door, take right and then and first to the left. There is a perfect breakfast café; juice, coffee, sandwiches, fruits and bakery.
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel, small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the hotel has a sauna and shower area in the cellar, we had it all by our selves! It was great after a long day of sightseeing, seems new, fresh and clean. Lots of towels!
reviews.title: Fell in love with it!

reviews.text: I absolutely loved everything about the hotel, the art, the Andy Warhol dbl room where we made a couple of good pix. The location is good, close to all the sightseeing by subway. The receptionist was helpful. Bed sheets were super clean and the bed was comfortable. The room is a little bit too small but I can stand this for the sake of art :)
reviews.title: well located cool hotel- Berlin
Good room, good wifi, great city
reviews.text: The only real (though still minor for me) downside was (as mentioned by others already) that the shower doesn't have a door and there is a water all over the floor each time you take a shower. If do it late in the evening though and leave it till morning, the floor will be dry by then.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the art'otel in Berlin (West) is super conveniently located, nicely decorated in a Andy Warhol them, quite funky, without being over the top. Also there is a great litle bar, friendly and helpful staff as well a good breakfast. But the location really gives them 10 out of 10, just minutes from the Ku Dam, the shops, cafes and restaurants are all very near, also convenient if you are attending an event at Messe Berlin, like ITB
reviews.title: Great Hotel with interesting nearby street cafes in Ludwigkirkplatz

reviews.text: I was really impressed with this - good value, clean and spacious and the decor was a bit out of the ordinary. The breakfast and bar were good. Much better than the first hotel I stayed in in Berlin and about the same price.
reviews.title: Nice pretty clean hotel

reviews.text: I used Priceline and ended up with this hotel ($60 per night in late October). What a great surprise. Extremely nice staff, spacious rooms, large bathroom, and less than 5 min walk to the metro. Breakfast was pretty good. You can rent a bike from the hotel which was very convenient to explore the city with. Free computers with internet to use for free in lobby.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again. I want to emphasize how nice the staff was. Always smiling.
reviews.title: Delusive

reviews.text: This hotel was a big disspointment, they didn't have a double bed eventho we ask for it 3 months in advace, the beds are very crappy the kind you sink into it everytime you move.
reviews.title: Another hotel

reviews.text: Our room seemed
reviews.title: Quiet hotel near Kurfürstendam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay there for five nights. The hotel is located on a main noisy road but in a nice and elegant neighbourhood. There are lot of cosy and smart restaurants and cafe in the vicinity - lots of dining options. The staff are very nice and helpful. The room is very basic, large enough and clean, but a bit "cold" and not so intimate. We check one hour before offical check-in time and they charged us for an extra 5 euro for it!!! - we checked out 4 hours before time and didn't get credit for that.... As previous reviewer has noticed, the airconditioner didn't work and the room was too hot at night. We asked the reception to solve the problem but they didn't take care of it!
reviews.title: good value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to stay on the west side of the city and not to spend lots of money - it's a good choice. If you expect to stay in a place more characteristic - stay away.
reviews.title: Lovely for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For 38GBP on Priceline this hotel was excellent value for our four night stay if you're wanting to stay in the West End. Like a previous reviewer, I also received a lovely fruit platter on my birthday - a really nice touch. No problems with the room other than it was a bit hot at night (maybe the aircon wasn't working?). The bathrooms are large with walk-in shower.
reviews.title: Excellent Location to Explore West Berlin

reviews.text: All the young staff were extremely polite and helpful. Didn't try the restaurant, but the bar area is quite cool.
reviews.title: Nice & stylish
Decent hotel
reviews.text: Location is 2 minute walk from the Ku'dam, and about 5 or 10 minutes from the S-Bahn station at Savignyplatz (try the always busy Italian restaurant XII Apostolis next to the station for excellent food and lively atmosphere).

Just back from five of the best days ever in Berlin. art'otel city center west just added to the stay. My room was bright and very clean and the mini bar was a good idea. The staff that I met on reception were friendly and helpful and so thanks to all those that made my stay so nice. As for location - I did tend to go to the East most days - but that was only a short journey on Ubhan S Bahn trains, and buses are everywhere too. I loved Berlin and got to see so much of the city. Great to chill out in one of the cool bars at night and in the day I did a couple of group tours which took us to great places in the city and I got to see some brilliant street artists work, which I loved.. Going to be back in the summer and hope to stay at the art'otel again as it was so easy to get to everywhere in the city and was as good as the other reviews had said.
reviews.title: Amazing Berlin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is modern, bright, clean, well run, with helpful and courteous staff. The rooms are good, beds very comfortable, well airconditioned. The price and breakfast are good. I fully recommend this hotel. The only qualification is that for us the interesting part of Berlin is on the other side of the town.
reviews.title: An Excellent Quality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a weekend trip to Berlin staying in the Art Otel ... excellent service and attention to detail. In fact when I was there I was celebrating my birthday and came back from a day's sightseeing to find a personally written card and a fruit basket in the room. Rooms very clean and well maintained. When we were there the housekeeping staff came in to clean the bottles and inside of the mini bar... something that lacks in many hotels..... overall had a great location and stay, with a few nice restaurants around the corner and a great patisserie on the next street. When we return to Berlin (which we plan to do) we will stay here again for sure..... Thanks Again to the staff....
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel....Staff very professional and Friendly

reviews.text: I was very impressed by this hotel - not by any single feature - but by the overall package. It offers a surprisingly low rate for a hotel in a great location that is clean, bright and airy - and carried off in style. I wish that boutique budget hotels could be more like this one. I took some snaps on Nomadz, if you want to see more.
reviews.title: Buget with Style

reviews.text: Just back from a short break to Berlin with husband and two 18 year olds. This hotel is ideally situated just off the main shopping street in West Berlin. The bus journey from Tegel airport is around 20 minutes, with the nearest stop being about 3 minutes walk from the hotel. The fare is only 2.20 euros per person and buses run every 10 minutes. The overground and underground station, plus the bus depot, at the Zoo is a pleasant 10 minute walk away. From there you can easily access all of Berlin's attractions.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, spotless rooms and tasty breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at this hotel at 01:30 in the morning after an 18 hour journey because of the appalling weather. Very friendly service. They gave us a lovely large room overlooking the street with good sized beds. Nicely situated but unfortunately, the local underground line was mostly closed for maintenance. However, the buses were great. Breakfast is the normal 'continental' style. There was no evening restaurant on site but plenty of good local restaurants.
reviews.title: Very good, friendly hotel (especially if you like Andy Warhol)

reviews.text: I stayed here with a bunch of friends on a stag do. From what I can remember is was a funky stylish hotel, the rooms were clean tidy and modern with a funky bar and restaurant and it was very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Funky Hotel

reviews.text: Berlin is a great city with a buzzing night life and it is steeped with history.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.text: The hotel was great,very clean with comfortable rooms.The staff was extremely helpful when we asked for directions.It was just about 5 min walk to the nearest metro station and the most popular street(kurfusterdam strasse).The price was very good and i would recommend it without a second thought.
reviews.title: Good hotel but minor downfalls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I do rate this hotel and enjoyed my stay there were a few things that nagged me. Mainly the door lock system. We were repeatedly told at reception to put the key against the lock, twist and push. It doesn't work. They forgot to tell us that in fact you have to pull the door towards you after twisting the lock and then push. What was ever wrong with a normal lock??!
reviews.title: Good Hotel...

reviews.text: Me and my sister went to this hotel last September for three nights- Friday, Sat & Sun. We got a bit lost coming out of the zoo train station so the work was longer than if we had known the way. The hotel is actually just a minute away from Ku'damm and there's three easily accessible underground stations nearby. Check in wasn' until 3pm but when we arrived at 11.30am our room was ready and the reception staff were really helpful. The young man gave us a map and marked where the hotel was and where local underground stations and good restaurants where. The room was spacious, very clean & fabuously decorated- we had some drunken fun on the chair that spun round! the beds were big and comfy, bathroom was huge & air conditioning was easy to use & effective.
reviews.title: Cool hotel with great style

likes.liked: — Stylish interior, well stocked bar & helpful reception staff
likes.disliked: — Slow lift & the bright interior if you have a hangover

reviews.text: Didn't use hotel restaurant but did use the bar and found the staff were friendly and the drinks very strong! Overall we loved this hotel- it was very cool and relaxed, in a great location for shopping and getting around generally and had lots of beer gardens nearby. Hard Rock cafe is also a five min walk away if you fancy a retro evening. I loved this hotel and would definitely recommend it, especially as the prices are so reasonable - £210 for two people for three nights. Uber bargain.
reviews.title: What a great hotel!

likes.liked: — The modern, bright and lively decor

reviews.title: Pefect value for money
reviews.text: On a leisure trip, we stayed at this hotel because the friends we were traveling with had already pre-booked there, so there was pretty much no choice. However, I have to say that this was a good experience! An artsy hotel (as the name implies), pop-artsy to be exact, with Andy Warhol holding court on walls, decorations and colour schemes -- a very bright and pleasant environment! Very young and extremely friendly staff, OK bar and food, expensive but good breakfast (wasn't included), great rooms in lime green colour schemes, spotlessly clean, central (very near the famous Kudamm)... the list goes on and on. The only drawback seemed to be the very strange room door opening system. All in all, a very positive experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazed that for 180 GBP pp, we got such lush accommodation and flights via lastminute. This designer hotel is 5mins walk from Ulanstrause Station, handy if you are travelling by tubes. Its is off street from busy areas and tourist, but has loads of good affordable eating outlet nearby (recommend Goyst restaurant if you want good, cheap seafood located in front of the metro station). It is also within 5 mins walking distance to Kurfurstendamn, which is one of the busier districts.. Rooms were immaculately clean and superb finish of the designer touch. The bar downstairs was excellent for chilling out and funky coloured deco was perfect after a long day of travelling. I cant comment on the food, as it was over our budget, but there were so many restaurants around the area that made choosing difficult. If I were visiting Berlin again, I would definitely stay here again. Staff were friendly and helpful..
reviews.title: Super Hotel,but not too clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice modern Andy Warhol Hotel. The Room was very big but there were spots over the bed. The staff was very jung but friendly and the location good.
reviews.title: Not really a 4* hotel

likes.disliked: — Style of hotel is not my taste

reviews.text: The hotel is on good location very close to the Kdamm, subways and bus stop. The area is safe, even late at night. Stayed 5 nights with family in two comfortable, clean, rooms with communicating doors. Staff are very helpful and friendly and ready to help every time. godd value for money.
reviews.title: recommended

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights with family with not comfy room...but it located on good location...it's on walk able to reach subway and bus stop. Staffs are really nice. All of them are ready to help every time even after checked out. Love them!!!
reviews.title: Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Art'otel is a great choice for your stay in Berlin. Clean, nice rooms, great breakfast (so choose the alternative including breakfast). The staff is very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It takes about ten minutes to walk to Zoo Garden. We walked every day to what ever we wanted to see. If you don't like to walk there are buses and subway close by to take you where ever you want to go. The location area feels perfectly safe, even late at night.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, lovely facilities & well stocked rooms, but patchy wifi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here Feb 13 with my wife on a room only basis, so I can't comment on breakfast. We got the rooms form about £35 a night, so v. cheap
reviews.title: Fantastic - very highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best breakfast known to man (well, 2nd best: the best is available at the E&O Hotel, Penang). There was simply everything and anything available including smoked salmon and champagne! Buffet style too. Cheesetastic.
reviews.title: Great Breakfasts

reviews.text: Berlin's quite a noisy city and despite being doubly double-glazed there was still some road noise. Room had minibar which was curiously and obtrusively filled by staff shortly after our arrival, ie without knocking. Decor Ikea like. Good bathroom. Plenty of frills. Styling unusal.
reviews.title: Great stay; great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Southern Germany for the World Cup and decided to take a trip north to Berlin with our three kids. We picked this hotel based on the feedback from Tripadvisor and were very impressed. Room were an excellent value for the money, were extrememly clean and quiet, and had excellent access to the shopping, eating, transportation and sightseeing. The breakfast was very reasonable and quite good. I had stayed in Berlin for three nights ealier in the trip at a different hotel and paid three times as much for 1/2 the ambiance and experience. I would absolutely stay here again. The only downsides were limited on-site parking and (like most German hotels) limited ability to sleep two adults and three kids in one room.
reviews.title: Very Modern, Art Hotel

likes.liked: — The Quality of the Room and the Amenities

reviews.text: Very nice and clean hotel. We spend there 4 nights and everything was excellent. The hotel was very modern, the room huge, painted in a nice light green colour. The beds very comfortable and pretty big and the bathroom stylish and clean. The people in the reception were polite giving us details for what to do during our stay. There were only 2 things that were not so good. The coffee station is not availiable in rooms of the lowest category (Fortunately we knew and we had booked a room of a higher class) and secondly the elevator is really slow, so I used many times the stairs and as we were staying in the 5th floor it was sometimes tiring.
reviews.title: nice 3+ star (nearly 4 star) hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good modern hotel, better than 3star but not quite 4star... good for tourists, or even business travelers. small but clean rooms. good hotel, but nothing special... great location of course
reviews.title: Great Value.

reviews.text: We spent six nights at the hotel. We had booked a XL-room and got a big one (515). I think the normal ones might be better value, ours had one rather small window facing the back of the hotel. The ones I saw at the front seemed brighter and lighter. Nevertheless it was really quiet which I appreciate.
reviews.title: Good and quiet location in the West

reviews.text: Location is great. Kurfürstendam and all the shopping and the Underground just around the corner. We had not booked breakfast but ate at different cafés nearby. Berlin bakeries offer nice breakfast!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went back to the airport by bus 109, the fare is 2,40€. Bus stop Uhlandstrasse, a very short walk away.
reviews.title: cost doesn't match value

reviews.text: The hotel itself is modern and has good average standard.
reviews.title: Cool, clean and friendly.

reviews.text: The hotel is only some minutes away from Kurfürstendamm boulevard. To the nearest subway station (Uhlandstr.) it will take approximately 5 minutes. The S-Bahn station at Savignyplatz can be reached by walking 10 minutes. All in all a very central location in the western part of Berlin.
reviews.title: A first but not the last

reviews.text: The hotel has a very good location and carries a good price. However I didn't really like the room design which was to simple for my taste, other may like it. The desk char didn't have a backrest and though there were three bottles in the bathroom none of them were labelled shampoo. I was also disappointed that their free wifi came with a data transfer limit, which was quickly exhausted when watching online tv. Hadn't I known I would have guessed that this hotel carried three stars. Reception staff was very nice and helpful though.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a three night trip to Berlin, staying at te Artótel. We loved the hotel and were surprised by the decoration of the room. The interior was very nicely done, the room was very clean and we had enough space. Breakfast is nicely stocked, good for a nice start of a busy day.
reviews.title: Excellent city hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The neighbourhood was nice, although not in the middle of the action. There are enough restaurants in the area, public transport is a 5-minute walk away.
reviews.title: Not Customer Oriented

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay in this hotel again, it has everything that you need for a cityhotel. The hotelbar was empty every night, but there's more than enough places around to get your beer.
reviews.title: Basic Hotel Accomodation

reviews.text: I never actually managed to stay in this hotel given their draconian cancellation policy. Although I hear their rooms are quite small by someone else who stayed there. My partner had an unforeseen and necessary business meeting called so we had no choice but to consider moving the dates. We had pre-paid through Expedia but it wasn't up to Expedia to see if we could move the dates - it was up to the hotel (Expedia indicated that many hotels are willing to move dates as long as their costs are covered). After several calls 7 days and then 4 days before the reservation and indicating that I would pay any additional charge due to a possible rate change for the new dates requested - they simply decide to take my money for no service because they could. This isn't reasonable trade or people - I think it represents a bad attitude to customers which I assume will be reflected in the type of service it provides. Granted many will consider this review just sour grapes based on bad luck, but I think many others will agree this is the type of establishment to avoid.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but great value

reviews.text: I had a very positive experience at this hotel. I stayed for 6 nights in May.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay here.

reviews.text: Room was perfectly adequate and comfortable. Staff were all very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Very good
Thumbs up for Art'Otel Berlin
reviews.text: My first room on the 6th floor was huge ( or maybe because i had just been staying in Amsterdam! ) and my second room smaller but again fine.
I would definately stay here again !
reviews.title: Fun place! Perfect location!

reviews.text: Nothing bad to say about the hotel, the service on recption was great they couldn't be more helpful, they have thought of everything including lending you a brolly if it's raining.
reviews.title: Loved it!

aka: Art`Otel Berlin City Center West Hotel
description: Central Berlin hotel features Warhol ArtConveniently located near ICC Berlin and the Ku'damm, a major shopping destination, the distinctively designed art'otel berlin city center west displays original artworks by famous pop artist Andy Warhol and offers guests a variety of amenities, including free wi-fi. Guests at our central, boutique-style Berlin hotel also enjoy spacious rooms and private parking. Ideal for both leisure and business travellers, our accommodations in Berlin offer comprehensive business services, fitness room and a brand new sauna facility. With its trendy, art-inspired design, comfortable rooms and first-rate amenities, the art'otel is one of the top Berlin city center hotels.
